delta methods
absX + Misc.random(2);
absY + Misc.random(2);
ftw

item.title: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Um. You’re putting the coords for multi after you’re calling it, and also,
Math.random() * 2681 would come out a way bigger number than you’d want.

Also, like Vain_ would tell you, you don’t want to loop through max players…

if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if (p != null) { if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(player)) { int locations[][] = { {2683, 3489}, {2681, 3490}, {2685, 3488} }; int randomLocation = Misc.random(locations.length-1); Client n = (Client)p; n.teleportToX = locations[randomLoaction][0]; n.teleportToY = locations[randomLoaction][1]; n.Jail = true; n.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "+c.playerName+""); c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "+n.playerName+"."); } } } }catch(Exception e){ c.sendMessage("Try ::jail playerName"); } }

You were also missing some }'s and a catch for your try statement, in theory the code above should work (didn’t care to test).

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317
item.dc:creator: @Noobinator9907 Noobinator9907
item.description:
@Noobinator9907 wrote:

Could you take a look at my code and see where I’ve gone wrong? I can’t seem to figure it out it’s been ages since I’ve done multi-dimensional arrays. Thanks for all the help!

if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 2683 + (Math.random() * multi.length -1); c2.teleportToY = 3489 + (Math.random() * multi.length -1); int[][] multi = new int[3][2]; multi[0][0] = 2681; multi[0][1] = 3489; multi[0][2] = 2685; multi[0][3] = 3489; c2.Jail = true; c2.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "+c.playerName+""); c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "+c2.playerName+"."); } } }

This is my error in the compiler

@hadesflames wrote:

Setup a two dimmensional array with the coordinates then use the random function the way I did above to pick a random Coordinate. Use Math.random() * yourarray.length -1

item.title: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317
item.dc:creator: @Noobinator9907 Noobinator9907
item.description:
@Noobinator9907 wrote:

Could I set that up in a way so it chooses the coordinates? So it would randomly choose between 3 coordinates.

I.E it would either teleport the player to 2678, 9837 1789, 2749 or 2890, 7689. Sorry if I am being unclear. Thanks again! (Variables for X and Y were just randomly typed, no meaning behind them.)

item.source: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317

item.title: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

c2.teleportToX = xxxx;
c2.teleportToY = xxxx;

change to

c2.teleportToX = xxxx + (Math.random() * 3);
c2.teleportToY = xxxx + (Math.random() * 3);

item.title: How do you make a teleport choose multiple x,y coordinates? 317
item.dc:creator: @Noobinator9907 Noobinator9907
item.description:
@Noobinator9907 wrote:

Howdy! So my jail code looks a little something like this

if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = xxxx; c2.teleportToY = xxxx; c2.Jail = true; c2.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "+c.playerName+""); c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "+c2.playerName+"."); } } }

And I can’t for the life of me remember how to make the command teleport the player to multiple coordinates. I haven’t worked on a server in 3 or 4 years and my last source had this I just cannot remember the code for it. I believe it has something to with Random Ints.

In a nutshell; I’d like to make the ::jail command teleport the designated player to 3 randomly chosen specified x,y locations. Any ideas?

Thanks!

(Using a PI 317 I believe)

Read full topic
